text: Hey, do people actually use the dedicated numpads on notebooks? I wish I could trade it in against properly sized up/down/left/right keys.  Having a dedicated numpad feels like the designer imagined the notebook user as a  data clerk putting in numbers all day long.

text:
I never use the numpad.
Ever. On any computer.

I kind of resent the extra space it takes up on my desk.
Adds 1 extra second to time from moving between keyboard and mouse.
That is probably a minute wasted each day.
That's 6 hours wasted a year.

text:
I own one.
It's pretty good. I used it for a few years.
But the range of options for keyboards with no numpads are much reduced.
Since the start of the pandemic (since not in office to annoy others) I have been using a Model M clone, I couldn't find any buckling spring keyboard without a numpad.

Also a lot of the ones that have no numpad are compact designs (including my old one). That skip things like the Exit, the F1, F2 etc, Home Insert etc
